text:
A <keyref> requires a <selector> child and 1 or more <field> child(ren). Here 
is an example of a <keyref> missing a child <field> and the parser does not 
report the error.

3_11si22.xsd
============
<schema xmlns          ="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"
        targetNamespace="http://www.schemaTest.org/3_11si"
        xmlns:si       ="http://www.schemaTest.org/3_11si">

<element name="Library">
  <complexType>
    <sequence>
      <element name="Book" type="si:bookType" maxOccurs="unbounded"/>
      <element name="Codes" type="si:codesType">
        <key name="barCodeKey">
          <selector xpath="BarCode"/>
          <field xpath="."/>
        </key>
      </element>
    </sequence>
  </complexType>
  <keyref name="keyRef1" refer="si:barCodeKey">
    <selector xpath="Book"/>
  </keyref>
</element>

<complexType name="bookType">
  <simpleContent>
    <extension base="string">
      <attribute name="barcode" type="string" use="required"/>
      <attribute name="libcode" type="string" use="required"/>
    </extension>
  </simpleContent>
</complexType>

<complexType name="codesType">
  <sequence>
    <element name="BarCode" type="string" maxOccurs="unbounded"/>
    <element name="LibCode" type="string" maxOccurs="unbounded"/>
  </sequence>
</complexType>

</schema>

3_11si22.xml
============
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<sii:Library xmlns:xsi         ="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
             xmlns:sii         ="http://www.schemaTest.org/3_11si"
             xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.schemaTest.org/3_11si
                                 3_11si22.xsd">

<Book barcode="A1" libcode="A1">The First Book</Book>
<Book barcode="A2" libcode="A2">The Next Book</Book>

<Codes>
  <BarCode>A1</BarCode>
  <BarCode>A2</BarCode>
  <LibCode>A1</LibCode>
  <LibCode>A2</LibCode>
</Codes>

</sii:Library>
creator: mhuffman@ca.ibm.com
